title: Summary
text: performed self-review code commented code, particularly hard--understand areas made corresponding changes documentation changes generate new warnings added tests prove fix effective feature works New existing unit tests pass locally changes dependent changes merged published downstream modules

title: Release Process
text: follow stable mainline approach main always reflects latest published version CRAN. Note small delay release merged main published CRAN.

title: Release Process
text: Create pre-release branch main (e.g., release/v3.1.0) Internal testing installing GitHub branch devtools::install_github("synthesizebio/rsynthbio@release/v3.1.0") Merge main validated Publish CRAN publish_to_cran github action

title: Getting Started
text: can install rsynthbio CRAN: want development version, can install using remotes package install GitHub: installed, load package:
code: install.packages("rsynthbio") if (!("remotes" %in% installed.packages())) {   install.packages("remotes") } remotes::install_github("synthesizebio/rsynthbio") library(rsynthbio)

title: Getting Started
text: using Synthesize Bio API, need set API token. package provides secure way handle authentication: Loading API key session. can obtain API token registering Synthesize Bio.
code: # Securely prompt for and store your API token # The token will not be visible in the console set_synthesize_token()  # You can also store the token in your system keyring for persistence # across R sessions (requires the 'keyring' package) set_synthesize_token(use_keyring = TRUE) # In future sessions, load the stored token load_synthesize_token_from_keyring()  # Check if a token is already set has_synthesize_token()

title: Getting Started
text: security reasons, remember clear token ’re done: Never hard-code token scripts shared committed version control.
code: # Clear token from current session clear_synthesize_token()  # Clear token from both session and keyring clear_synthesize_token(remove_from_keyring = TRUE)

title: Getting Started
text: first step identify model want use prediction: gem-1-bulk: Bulk RNA-seq (asynchronous hood, returned data frames) gem-1-sc: Single-cell RNA-seq (asynchronous hood, returned data frames) can check models available programmatically:
code: # Check available models list_models() # Create a query for the bulk model bulk_query <- get_example_query(model_id = "gem-1-bulk") bulk <- predict_query(bulk_query, model_id = "gem-1-bulk")  # Create a query for the single-cell model sc_query <- get_example_query(model_id = "gem-1-sc") sc <- predict_query(sc_query, model_id = "gem-1-sc")

title: Getting Started
text: structure query required API specific model. can use get_example_query() get correctly structured example chosen model. query consists : “sample generation”: Generates realistic-looking synthetic data measurement error (bulk ) “mean estimation”: Provides stable mean estimates expression levels (bulk single-cell) inputs: list biological conditions generate data input contains metadata (describing biological sample) num_samples (many samples generate). See Query Parameters section detailed documentation mode optional query fields.
code: # Get the example query structure for a specific model example_query <- get_example_query(model_id = "gem-1-bulk")  # Inspect the query structure str(example_query)

title: Getting Started
text: query ready, can send API generate gene expression data: result list two dataframes: metadata expression
code: result <- predict_query(query, model_id = "gem-1-bulk")

title: Getting Started
text: Behind scenes, API uses asynchronous model handle queries efficiently: query submitted API, returns query ID function automatically polls status endpoint (default: every 2 seconds) query completes, results downloaded signed URL Data parsed returned R data frames happens automatically call predict_query().

title: Getting Started
text: can customize polling behavior needed:
code: # Increase timeout for large queries (default: 900 seconds = 15 minutes) result <- predict_query(   query,   model_id = "gem-1-bulk",   poll_timeout_seconds = 1800, # 30 minutes   poll_interval_seconds = 5 # Check every 5 seconds instead of 2 )

title: Getting Started
text: input metadata list lists. full list valid metadata keys: Biological: age_years cell_line_ontology_id cell_type_ontology_id developmental_stage disease_ontology_id ethnicity genotype race sample_type (“cell line”, “organoid”, “”, “primary cells”, “primary tissue”, “xenograft”) sex (“male”, “female”) tissue_ontology_id Perturbational: perturbation_dose perturbation_ontology_id perturbation_time perturbation_type (“coculture”,“compound”,“control”,“crispr”,“genetic”,“infection”,“”,“overexpression”,“peptide biologic”,“shrna”,“sirna”) Technical: study (Bioproject ID) library_selection (e.g., “cDNA”, “polyA”, “Oligo-dT” - see https://ena-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/submit/reads/webin-cli.html#permitted-values--library-selection) library_layout (“PAIRED”, “SINGLE”) platform (“illumina”)

title: Getting Started
text: following valid values expected formats selected metadata keys: highly recommend using EMBL-EBI Ontology Lookup Service find valid IDs metadata. Models limited acceptable range metadata input values. provide value acceptable range, API return error.

title: Getting Started
text: addition metadata, queries support several optional parameters control generation process:

previous_headings: Designing Queries for Models > Query Parameters
title: Getting Started
text: Controls type prediction model generates. parameter required queries. Available modes: “sample generation”: model works identically mean estimation approach, except final gene expression distribution also sampled generate realistic-looking synthetic data captures error associated measurements. mode useful want data mimics real experimental measurements. “mean estimation”: model creates distribution capturing biological heterogeneity consistent supplied metadata. distribution sampled predict gene expression distribution captures measurement error. mean distribution serves prediction. mode useful want stable estimate expected expression levels. Note: Single-cell queries support “mean estimation” mode. Bulk queries support modes.
code: # Bulk query with sample generation (default for bulk) bulk_query <- get_example_query(model_id = "gem-1-bulk") bulk_query$mode <- "sample generation"  # Bulk query with mean estimation bulk_query_mean <- get_example_query(model_id = "gem-1-bulk") bulk_query_mean$mode <- "mean estimation"  # Single-cell query (must use mean estimation) sc_query <- get_example_query(model_id = "gem-1-sc") sc_query$mode <- "mean estimation" # Required for single-cell

previous_headings: Designing Queries for Models > Query Parameters
title: Getting Started
text: Library size used converting predicted log CPM back raw counts. Higher values scale counts proportionally.
code: # Create a query and add custom total_count query <- get_example_query(model_id = "gem-1-bulk") query$total_count <- 5000000

previous_headings: Designing Queries for Models > Query Parameters
title: Getting Started
text: TRUE, model uses mean latent distribution (p(z|metadata) q(z|x)) instead sampling. removes randomness latent sampling produces deterministic outputs inputs. Default: FALSE (sampling enabled)
code: # Create a query and enable deterministic latents query <- get_example_query(model_id = "gem-1-bulk") query$deterministic_latents <- TRUE

previous_headings: Designing Queries for Models > Query Parameters
title: Getting Started
text: Random seed reproducibility using stochastic sampling. can combine multiple parameters single query:
code: # Create a query with a specific seed query <- get_example_query(model_id = "gem-1-bulk") query$seed <- 42 # Create a query and add multiple parameters query <- get_example_query(model_id = "gem-1-bulk") query$total_count <- 8000000 query$deterministic_latents <- TRUE query$mode <- "mean estimation"  results <- predict_query(query, model_id = "gem-1-bulk")

title: Getting Started
text: can customize query inputs fit specific research needs:
code: # Get a base query query <- get_example_query(model_id = "gem-1-bulk")  # Adjust number of samples for the first input query$inputs[[1]]$num_samples <- 10  # Add a new condition query$inputs[[3]] <- list(   metadata = list(     sex = "male",     sample_type = "primary tissue",     tissue_ontology_id = "UBERON:0002371"   ),   num_samples = 5 )

title: Getting Started
text: may want process data chunks save later use:
code: # Access metadata and expression matrices metadata <- result$metadata expression <- result$expression  # Check dimensions dim(expression)  # View metadata sample head(metadata) # Save results to RDS file saveRDS(result, "synthesize_results.rds")  # Load previously saved results result <- readRDS("synthesize_results.rds")  # Export as CSV write.csv(result$expression, "expression_matrix.csv") write.csv(result$metadata, "sample_metadata.csv")

code: @Manual{,   title = {rsynthbio: Synthesize Bio API Wrapper},   author = {{Synthesize Bio}},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 4.0.0},   url = {https://github.com/synthesizebio/rsynthbio}, }

title: Synthesize Bio API Wrapper
text: rsynthbio R package provides convenient interface Synthesize Bio API, allowing users generate realistic gene expression data based specified biological conditions. package enables researchers easily access AI-generated transcriptomic data various modalities, including bulk RNA-seq single-cell RNA-seq. generate datasets without code, use web platform. See full documentation . questions, suggestions, support, email us support@synthesize.bio.

title: Synthesize Bio API Wrapper
text: can install rsynthbio CRAN: install development version GitHub, use remotes package: installed, load package:
code: install.packages("rsynthbio") if (!("remotes" %in% installed.packages())) {   install.packages("remotes") } remotes::install_github("synthesizebio/rsynthbio") library(rsynthbio)

text: using Synthesize Bio API, need set API token. package provides secure way handle authentication: Load API token session: can obtain API token registering Synthesize Bio.

text: security reasons, remember clear token ’re done: Never hard-code token scripts shared committed version control.

title: Synthesize Bio API Wrapper
text: Please see Getting Started guide comprehensive documentation.

title: Synthesize Bio API Wrapper
text: first step identify model want use prediction: Currently supported models: gem-1-bulk: Bulk RNA-seq data (supports “sample generation” “mean estimation” modes) gem-1-sc: Single-cell RNA-seq data (supports “mean estimation” mode )
code: # Check available models models <- list_models() print(models)  # Create a query for the bulk RNA-seq model bulk_query <- get_example_query(model_id = "gem-1-bulk")$example_query  # Create a query for the single-cell model sc_query <- get_example_query(model_id = "gem-1-sc")$example_query

title: Synthesize Bio API Wrapper
text: get_example_query() function returns correctly structured example query specific model: query consists : “sample generation”: Realistic synthetic data measurement error (bulk ) “mean estimation”: Stable mean estimates (bulk single-cell) inputs: list biological conditions generate data input contains: metadata: list metadata key-value pairs describing biological sample num_samples: number samples generate condition See Query Parameters section detailed information mode optional fields.
code: # Get a sample query for a specific model query <- get_example_query(model_id = "gem-1-bulk")$example_query  # Inspect the query structure str(query)

title: Synthesize Bio API Wrapper
text: API uses asynchronous model: query submitted, system polls completion, results downloaded ready. happens automatically:
code: # Request raw counts data result <- predict_query(query, model_id = "gem-1-bulk")  # The function will automatically: # 1. Submit your query to the API # 2. Poll for completion (default: checks every 2 seconds) # 3. Download and parse results when ready # 4. Return formatted data frames  # Access the results metadata <- result$metadata expression <- result$expression

title: Synthesize Bio API Wrapper
text: can customize polling behavior model parameters:
code: # Adjust polling timeout (default: 15 minutes) result <- predict_query(   query,   model_id = "gem-1-bulk",   poll_timeout_seconds = 1800,  # 30 minutes   poll_interval_seconds = 5      # Check every 5 seconds )  # Get log-transformed CPM instead of raw counts result_log <- predict_query(query, model_id = "gem-1-bulk")  # Use deterministic latents for reproducible results # (removes randomness from latent sampling) query$deterministic_latents <- TRUE result_det <- predict_query(query, model_id = "gem-1-bulk")  # Specify custom library size (total count) query$total_count <- 5000000 result_custom <- predict_query(query, model_id = "gem-1-bulk")  # Combine multiple options in the query query_combined <- get_example_query(model_id = "gem-1-bulk") query_combined$total_count <- 8000000 query_combined$deterministic_latents <- TRUE result_combined <- predict_query(query_combined, model_id = "gem-1-bulk")

title: Synthesize Bio API Wrapper
text: addition required fields, queries support several optional parameters: mode (character, required) Controls type prediction model generates: “sample generation”: model creates biological distribution, samples predict gene expression distribution capturing measurement error, samples distribution generate realistic-looking synthetic data. mode mimics real experimental measurements. Available bulk queries . “mean estimation”: model creates biological distribution, samples predict gene expression distribution capturing measurement error, returns mean prediction. Provides stable estimates. Available bulk single-cell queries. Note: Single-cell queries support “mean estimation” mode. total_count (integer, optional) Library size converting log CPM raw counts deterministic_latents (logical, optional) TRUE, uses mean latent distributions instead sampling Produces deterministic, reproducible outputs Default: FALSE seed (integer, optional) Random seed reproducibility stochastic sampling See Getting Started guide detailed documentation available metadata fields parameters.

title: Synthesize Bio API Wrapper
text: Free usage Synthesize Bio limited. exceed limit, receive error message stating ’ve exceeded limit. generate samples, please contact us support@synthesize.bio.

title: Predict Gene Expression — predict_query
text: Sends query Synthesize Bio API prediction retrieves gene expression samples. function sends query API processes response usable data frames.

title: Predict Gene Expression — predict_query
code: predict_query(   query,   model_id,   api_base_url = API_BASE_URL,   poll_interval_seconds = DEFAULT_POLL_INTERVAL_SECONDS,   poll_timeout_seconds = DEFAULT_POLL_TIMEOUT_SECONDS,   return_download_url = FALSE )

title: Predict Gene Expression — predict_query
text: query list representing query data send API. Use `get_example_query()` generate example. query supports additional optional fields: `total_count` (integer): Library size used converting predicted log CPM         back raw counts. Higher values scale counts proportionally. `deterministic_latents` (logical): TRUE, model uses mean         latent distribution instead sampling, producing deterministic outputs         inputs. Useful reproducibility. `seed` (integer): Random seed reproducibility. model_id Character string specifying model ID (e.g., "gem-1-bulk", "gem-1-sc"). Use `list_models()` see available models. api_base_url base URL API server. Default API_BASE_URL. poll_interval_seconds Seconds polling attempts status endpoint. Default DEFAULT_POLL_INTERVAL_SECONDS (2). poll_timeout_seconds Maximum total seconds wait timing . Default DEFAULT_POLL_TIMEOUT_SECONDS (900 = 15 minutes). return_download_url Logical, TRUE, returns list containing signed download URL instead parsing data frames. Default FALSE.

title: Predict Gene Expression — predict_query
text: list. `return_download_url` `FALSE` (default), list contains         two data frames: `metadata` `expression`. `TRUE`, list         contains `download_url` empty `metadata` `expression` data frames.

title: Predict Gene Expression — predict_query
code: # Set your API key (in practice, use a more secure method) if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  # To start using rsynthbio, first you need to have an account with synthesize.bio. # Go here to create one: https://app.synthesize.bio/  set_synthesize_token()  # Get available models models <- list_models()  # Create a query for a specific model query <- get_example_query(model_id = "gem-1-bulk")  # Request raw counts result <- predict_query(query, model_id = "gem-1-bulk")  # Access the results metadata <- result$metadata expression <- result$expression  # Explore the top expressed genes in the first sample head(sort(expression[1, ], decreasing = TRUE))  # Use deterministic latents for reproducible results query$deterministic_latents <- TRUE result_det <- predict_query(query, model_id = "gem-1-bulk")  # Specify a custom total count (library size) query$total_count <- 5000000 result_custom <- predict_query(query, model_id = "gem-1-bulk") } # }

what: Set Synthesize Bio API Token — set_synthesize_token
title: Set Synthesize Bio API Token — set_synthesize_token
text: Securely prompts stores Synthesize Bio API token environment. function uses getPass securely handle token input without displaying console. token stored SYNTHESIZE_API_KEY environment variable current R session.

title: Set Synthesize Bio API Token — set_synthesize_token
code: set_synthesize_token(use_keyring = FALSE, token = NULL)

title: Set Synthesize Bio API Token — set_synthesize_token
text: use_keyring Logical, whether also store token securely system keyring future sessions. Defaults FALSE. token Character, optional. provided, uses token instead prompting. parameter used non-interactive scripts.

title: Set Synthesize Bio API Token — set_synthesize_token
text: Invisibly returns TRUE successful.

title: Set Synthesize Bio API Token — set_synthesize_token
code: # Interactive prompt for token if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ set_synthesize_token()  # Provide token directly (less secure, not recommended for interactive use) set_synthesize_token(token = "your-token-here")  # Store in system keyring for future sessions set_synthesize_token(use_keyring = TRUE) } # }

title: rsynthbio 4.0.0
text: Model Agnostic Client: client updated support model ID via model_id parameter, enabling support current future Synthesize Bio models without package updates. Dynamic Model Support: Removed hardcoded model lists validations allow flexible usage new models.

title: rsynthbio 4.0.0
text: predict_query(): Now requires model_id parameter. New Query Helper: get_example_query(model_id) replaces get_valid_query(). Removed Functions: get_valid_query(), get_valid_modalities(), validate_modality() removed favor dynamic model support.
